|isbn=0261102664 |publisher=[[Eclipse Comics]], [[HarperCollins]], [[Del Rey]] |date=[[1989]],[[1990]] |format=| |pages=133 (revised edition) |amazon=http://www.amazon.com/Hobbit-Illustrated-Fantasy-Classic/dp/1435242726/ref=sr_1_6/105-7012052-9317230?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1212173630&sr=8-6 |amazonprice=$26.95 |}} '''The Hobbit: A Graphic Novel''' is a [[1989]] three issue comic book series, published by [[Eclipse Comics]]. In January [[1990]], they were bound as one in a trade paperback, and a revised edition was published in [[2006]]. To coincide with the [[The Hobbit (film series)|upcoming ''The Hobbit'' movies]], a new edition, with six new pages of artwork, was published on [[12 September]] [[2012]]. The story was adapted from the [[The Hobbit|original]] by [[Charles Dixon|Chuck Dixon]], and illustrated by [[David T. Wenzel]]. ==Contents (2025)== * Cover * Title Page * Copyright * Maps * ''The Hobbit: A Graphic Novel'' * There and Back Again * The Backstory * Creating the Artwork * About the Publisher ==Parts== [[Image:The Hobbit Comic Classic.jpg|left|thumb|The classic covers]] The three published issues were called '''Book One''', '''Book Two''' and '''Book Three''' (only so on the book's spine; nothing is seen on the front cover). The issues are numbered continuously: part one comprises pages 1 to 44 (up until the [[Riddles in the Dark|riddle-game]]), part two pages 45 to 88 (up until the [[Barrels Out of Bond|rafts of the Lake-men]]), and part three pages 89 to 133. ==From the Publisher == ===2006 edition === ''The Hobbit'' is the story of [[Bilbo Baggins]], a quiet and contented Hobbit whose life is turned upside down when he joins the wizard [[Gandalf]] and thirteen dwarves on their quest to reclaim stolen treasure. It is a journey fraught with danger - and in the end Bilbo alone must face [[Smaug|the guardian of the treasure]], the most dreaded [[dragons|dragon]] in all [[Middle-earth]]... J.R.R. Tolkien's enchanting prelude to ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' is one of the best-loved books of all time. Carefully abridged and beautifully painted, David Wenzel's graphic novel has become a best-selling classic in its own right. With more than 30 pages of new artwork and improvements by the artist, this new revised edition has been newly rescanned from the original paintings to produce the most authentic version ever published, to delight ''Hobbit'' fans old and new. === 2012 edition === In preparation for the December 2012 release of The Hobbit movie, this new edition of the full-color graphic novel adaptation of J.R.R. Tolkien's beloved story includes 6 new pages! First published more than sixty years ago, J. R. R. Tolkien's The Hobbit has become one of the best-loved books of all time. The enchanted prelude to The Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit is the story of Bilbo Baggins, a quiet and contented hobbit whose life is turned upside down when he joins the wizard Gandalf and thirteen dwarves on their quest to reclaim stolen treasure. It is a journey fraught with danger - and in the end it is Bilbo Baggins alone who must face the guardian of this treasure, the most dreaded dragon in all Middle-Earth. ==Publication history== In [[1989]] ''The Hobbit'' was adapted in a three issue comic book series, published by Eclipse Comics. The story was adapted from the original by Chuck Dixon, and illustrated by David T. Wenzel.
